Finding the perfect cologne these days can be difficult when such a wide variety of scents are available to us. Jean Paul Gaultier, renowned for its exceptional range of colognes, offers some of the best colognes for men, from the invigorating to the deeply sensual. Each scent, a masterpiece, caters to diverse preferences, ensuring there’s a signature smell for everyone. As an enthusiast of the best Jean Paul Gaultier colognes, I’ve personally selected and can attest to the quality and allure of each cologne listed, making them highly recommended for anyone seeking the epitome of fragrance sophistication. Key Takeaways The best scent from Jean Paul Gaultier now is the Jean Paul Gaultier Le Beau Men with its long-lasting, intensely confident woody scent. It’s been around for several years and remains one of my favorite Jean-Paul Gaultier colognes. As far as amber scents go, my favorite is the Jean Paul Gaultier Scandal Pour Homme Le Parfum. It’s another elegant, woody scent, but it’s even more intense with varying scent notes of geranium, tonka bean, and sandalwood. Let’s take a look at all the best JPG fragrances. In This ArticleOur PicksWhat To Look ForWhy You Should Trust Us Final VerdictFAQs jeanpaulgaultier / Instagram Best Overall: Jean Paul Gaultier Le Beau Men Why it’s great: Not only has it been a fan favorite since its launch in 2019 for its long-lasting aroma, but it also has an intoxicating woody scent of bergamot, coconut wood, and tonka bean that can make a man feel confident. This scent is versatile and suitable to wear on a night out, daily, or at work. Who is it for?: This cologne is favorable whether you’re younger or older and can evoke a sense of sexiness and power just from a few spritzes. The combination of its top, middle, and base notes creates a scent fit for paradise. Flaws but not deal-breakers: The smell is strong, which might not always be what you want, depending on the situation. Top Notes: Bergamot | Middle Notes: Coconut Wood | Base Notes: Tonka Bean | Size: 4.2 oz | Type: Spray | Season: Summer, Year-Round Best Amber Scent: Jean Paul Gaultier Scandal Por Homme Le Parfum Why it’s great: It features an incredible pairing of natural floral scents and the deep notes of sweet and rich sandalwood. Who is it for?: This product is best for men who enjoy their time outside of the house socializing. It is a sensual scent that evokes confidence on a night out. Its warmth makes it great for daily wear as well, but no matter where it’s worn, it’ll gain all kinds of positive attention. Flaws but not deal-breakers: This, too, is big and bold, so take care where you’re wearing it. Top Notes: Geranium | Middle Notes: Tonka Bean | Base Notes: Sandalwood | Size: 100 ml | Type: Eau De Parfum | Season: Year-Round Best Night Out Scent: Jean Paul Gaultier Le Male Le Parfum Why it’s great: With notes of cardamom, lavender, iris, and vanilla, this cologne showcases a strong sense and stability in the wearer’s masculinity. It’s empowering and alluring to any man who finds this scent as intoxicating as those around them will. Who is it for?: It’s a scent best suited to single, seeking men who want to draw attention from others, or men who want to match their cologne to their sleek style. Flaws but not deal-breakers: This one has been wildly popular since its introduction, so you might not want to smell like a dozen other men on your night out. Top Notes: Cardamom | Middle Notes: Lavender & iris | Base Notes: Vanilla | Size: 125 ml | Type: Eau De Parfum | Season: Winter Best Every Day Scent: Jean Paul Gaultier Ultra Male Jean Paul Gaultier Ultra Male is a woody, fruity, and floral cologne that leaves the wearer feeling powerful and masculine while embracing their softer side. Why it’s great: Bergamot, pear, mint, and lavender create a smooth and refreshing combination. The base note of woody vanilla adds a layer of warmth, creating a well-balanced cologne for every man. Who is it for?: With a medium intensity, this cologne is perfect for everyday use, lasts long for the office, and can transition smoothly to some drinks. Flaws but not deal-breakers: Despite the name (Ultra Male), this cologne has a floral feature that might be off-putting in an extremely masculine environment. Top Notes: Black Lavender | Middle Notes: Pear | Base Notes: Woody Vanilla | Size: 125 ml | Type: Eau De Toilette | Season: Year-round Best Budget Pick: Jean Paul Gaultier Le Male Aviator Men Popular brand name colognes tend to be expensive no matter where you purchase them;  however, the Jean Paul Gaultier Le Male Aviator Men is one of the cheaper colognes in Jean Paul’s collection. Why it’s great: With crisp notes of mint paired with rich woodsy base notes, this cologne is refreshing, confident, and perfect for daily use. Who is it for?: Despite the lower price, this is also a top pick amongst many men for its scent and long-lasting ability. This is a cologne for a man who has a budget but doesn’t want a cologne to reflect that in terms of quality. Flaws but not deal-breakers: I can’t imagine why this would be a bad thing, but this scent does last all day and into the night, so if you’re thinking about two completely different arenas in one 24-hour period, keep that in mind. Top Notes: Mint | Middle Notes: Violet Leaf | Base Notes: Woodsy |Size: 2.5 oz | Type: Spray | Season: Summer Best Unique Scent: Le Male Pride Eau De Toilette Although Jean Paul doesn’t seem to focus on musky scents, their Le Male Pride Eau De Toilette creates a complex pairing of sweet fruit and musk. Why it’s great: Not only is this scent a limited edition to celebrate gay pride, but it’s also a scent that captures a balance of feminine and masculine. Who is it for?: Whether you’re a gay man or you just find the long-lasting flavors of blood orange, orange blossom, and blond wood intoxicating, this scent has medium intensity and can be worn throughout the day or in the office. Flaws but not deal-breakers: The combination of blood orange and orange blossom just might be too much citrus for some guys. Top Notes: Blood Orange | Middle Notes: Orange Blossom | Base Notes: Blond Wood | Size: 125 ml | Type: Eau de Toilette | Season: Summer jeanpaulgaultier / Instagram Buying Considerations When it comes to deciding which Jean Paul Gaultier cologne is for you, there are several factors to take into account. When purchasing cologne, you want to consider price, scent, longevity, sillage, and seasonal preference. These five points can be determining factors in your decision. Price The price of cologne, especially a name brand like Jean Paul, will likely be higher than other non-name brand products no matter where you purchase it. These brands offer quality, but it’s the name that elevates its price so high. In comparison to other designer cologne brands, such as Gucci or Chanel, Jean Paul is a much cheaper option. In terms of other colognes without a big name attached to them, Jean Paul is pricier. This brand tends to stay in the same relative price range for most of its colognes, so if your budget matches, Jean Paul is the perfect price. Scent Smell is likely one of the most important factors to consider, so it’s crucial to know what your cologne smells like before you invest in a pricier option like Jean Paul Gaultier. If you purchase a cologne with a scent you dislike, it’s a waste of your time and money. Scents can also have an impact on the person wearing them and those around them. There are different reasons why we choose our favorite colognes. Some scents are sensual to women, some scents leave us feeling more energetic or confident, and some scents match our personalities. The scent you choose should be one you enjoy but also one that evokes the energy you want to give off. Longevity When picking a cologne to invest in, it’s crucial to consider how long-lasting it is. Longevity refers to how long the aroma remains on our bodies before it eventually fades from our skin. When purchasing a cologne, especially an expensive one, you want to ensure it won’t fade an hour after use. There is no point in wearing a cologne that fades easily, especially when they are designed to leave us smelling amazing for the duration of a work day or a night out. Checking reviews is the best way to determine the longevity of a product. Jean Paul Gaultier isn’t the most expensive name brand, but most colognes produce high-quality, long-lasting scents. Sillage Longevity and sillage go hand-in-hand, but they aren’t the same thing. Longevity refers to how long an aroma sticks; sillage refers to how far a cologne’s aroma reaches. How important it is for a cologne to be strong enough to smell it from a foot or two away is up to you. If you’re wearing cologne to impress those around you, you’ll want to ensure it has high sillage. Wearing a strong-scented cologne with high sillage is ideal, but if the person standing beside you can’t smell it, the purpose is defeated. However, if you’re wearing a cologne for your nose only, sillage may not be high on your priority list. Especially if you’re comfortable with just you or your significant other smelling the cologne, longevity and scent may be your biggest concerns. Seasonal Like food, clothes, and other luxuries in life, aromas can be seasonal. Certain scents can register with a particular time of the year, especially for those living in areas where the weather shifts every couple of months. For example, cinnamon and apple remind us of the fall or holiday seasons. Similarly, warm and woody colognes tend to be perfect for the winter months, reminding us of campfires and comfort foods. If you’re looking to purchase a cologne in the summer, you might want to consider finding energetic and refreshing colognes with fruity, aquatic, green, or energetic notes. These scents match the need for something refreshing when the sun is at its hottest. This matters only if you think it matters. The beauty of colognes and perfumes is our taste and what scents speak to us. You could find a cologne that you love and want to wear year-round. Our editors, with years of experience in the fashion and fragrance arenas, bring a critical eye to every product we recommend. We’re not just about following trends; we focus on timeless appeal, quality, and what genuinely stands out in a cologne—from its scent profile to its longevity. Our rigorous evaluation process involves detailed research, comparison, and testing. We dive into each fragrance’s nuances, ensuring our recommendations meet high standards of excellence. This dedication to authenticity means we stand by products we believe in, helping our readers make informed decisions that enhance their personal style. Final Verdict The best Jean Paul Gaultier cologne for men on our list is the Jean Paul Gaultier Le Beau Men, an intoxicating scent perfect for any man and for any time of the year. It’s a fan favorite and versatile, the two major reasons it’s the best choice overall. If you’re interested in other brands, here you can find the featured best colognes. FAQ The best Jean Paul Gaultier colognes have impeccable longevity and sillage. Most of the colognes on our list can last for daily use. Cologne can be something we wear to feel good about ourselves, but it can also be a means of seduction. The most sensual cologne scents are vanilla and amber, which balance soft, sweet, and spicy. Knowing who you are and what scents you enjoy can go a long way in determining which scent compliments you the best. Our personality can be represented in the colognes we wear and offer good first impressions to the people we meet. Choosing a scent we enjoy matters, but you can also base a scent on the season, your style, how you want to come across to others, or just about anything. It’s important to remember that not everyone will love a scent you do, so stay true to yourself when choosing one. A scent profile refers to the categories that specific aromas fall into and is a great way to determine which cologne is best for you. There are two main groups: warm and fresh. Warm includes musky scents like leather or bergamot, and fresh scents like floral and citrus are energizing. Finding the perfect cologne these days can be difficult when such a wide variety of scents are available to us. Jean Paul Gaultier, renowned for its exceptional range of colognes, offers some of the best colognes for men, from the invigorating to the deeply sensual.

Each scent, a masterpiece, caters to diverse preferences, ensuring there’s a signature smell for everyone. As an enthusiast of the best Jean Paul Gaultier colognes, I’ve personally selected and can attest to the quality and allure of each cologne listed, making them highly recommended for anyone seeking the epitome of fragrance sophistication.

Key Takeaways

The best scent from Jean Paul Gaultier now is the Jean Paul Gaultier Le Beau Men with its long-lasting, intensely confident woody scent. It’s been around for several years and remains one of my favorite Jean-Paul Gaultier colognes.

As far as amber scents go, my favorite is the Jean Paul Gaultier Scandal Pour Homme Le Parfum. It’s another elegant, woody scent, but it’s even more intense with varying scent notes of geranium, tonka bean, and sandalwood.

Let’s take a look at all the best JPG fragrances.


In This Article

  1. Our Picks
  2. What To Look For
  3. Why You Should Trust Us
  4. Final Verdict
  5. FAQs

Best Overall: Jean Paul Gaultier Le Beau Men

Why it’s great: Not only has it been a fan favorite since its launch in 2019 for its long-lasting aroma, but it also has an intoxicating woody scent of bergamot, coconut wood, and tonka bean that can make a man feel confident. This scent is versatile and suitable to wear on a night out, daily, or at work.

Who is it for?: This cologne is favorable whether you’re younger or older and can evoke a sense of sexiness and power just from a few spritzes. The combination of its top, middle, and base notes creates a scent fit for paradise.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: The smell is strong, which might not always be what you want, depending on the situation.

Top Notes: Bergamot | Middle Notes: Coconut Wood | Base Notes: Tonka Bean | Size: 4.2 oz | Type: Spray | Season: Summer, Year-Round

Best Amber Scent: Jean Paul Gaultier Scandal Por Homme Le Parfum

Why it’s great: It features an incredible pairing of natural floral scents and the deep notes of sweet and rich sandalwood.

Who is it for?: This product is best for men who enjoy their time outside of the house socializing. It is a sensual scent that evokes confidence on a night out. Its warmth makes it great for daily wear as well, but no matter where it’s worn, it’ll gain all kinds of positive attention.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: This, too, is big and bold, so take care where you’re wearing it.

Top Notes: Geranium | Middle Notes: Tonka Bean | Base Notes: Sandalwood | Size: 100 ml | Type: Eau De Parfum | Season: Year-Round

Best Night Out Scent: Jean Paul Gaultier Le Male Le Parfum

Why it’s great: With notes of cardamom, lavender, iris, and vanilla, this cologne showcases a strong sense and stability in the wearer’s masculinity. It’s empowering and alluring to any man who finds this scent as intoxicating as those around them will.

Who is it for?: It’s a scent best suited to single, seeking men who want to draw attention from others, or men who want to match their cologne to their sleek style.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: This one has been wildly popular since its introduction, so you might not want to smell like a dozen other men on your night out.

Top Notes: Cardamom | Middle Notes: Lavender & iris | Base Notes: Vanilla | Size: 125 ml | Type: Eau De Parfum | Season: Winter

Best Every Day Scent: Jean Paul Gaultier Ultra Male

Jean Paul Gaultier Ultra Male is a woody, fruity, and floral cologne that leaves the wearer feeling powerful and masculine while embracing their softer side.

Why it’s great: Bergamot, pear, mint, and lavender create a smooth and refreshing combination. The base note of woody vanilla adds a layer of warmth, creating a well-balanced cologne for every man.

Who is it for?: With a medium intensity, this cologne is perfect for everyday use, lasts long for the office, and can transition smoothly to some drinks.

Flaws but not deal-breakers: Despite the name (Ultra Male), this cologne has a floral feature that might be off-putting in an extremely masculine environment.

Top Notes: Black Lavender | Middle Notes: Pear | Base Notes: Woody Vanilla | Size: 125 ml | Type: Eau De Toilette | Season: Year-round

Best Budget Pick: Jean Paul Gaultier Le Male Aviator Men

Buying Considerations

When it comes to deciding which Jean Paul Gaultier cologne is for you, there are several factors to take into account. When purchasing cologne, you want to consider price, scent, longevity, sillage, and seasonal preference.

These five points can be determining factors in your decision.

Price

The price of cologne, especially a name brand like Jean Paul, will likely be higher than other non-name brand products no matter where you purchase it. These brands offer quality, but it’s the name that elevates its price so high.

In comparison to other designer cologne brands, such as Gucci or Chanel, Jean Paul is a much cheaper option. In terms of other colognes without a big name attached to them, Jean Paul is pricier.

This brand tends to stay in the same relative price range for most of its colognes, so if your budget matches, Jean Paul is the perfect price.

Scent

Smell is likely one of the most important factors to consider, so it’s crucial to know what your cologne smells like before you invest in a pricier option like Jean Paul Gaultier. If you purchase a cologne with a scent you dislike, it’s a waste of your time and money.

Scents can also have an impact on the person wearing them and those around them. There are different reasons why we choose our favorite colognes. Some scents are sensual to women, some scents leave us feeling more energetic or confident, and some scents match our personalities.

The scent you choose should be one you enjoy but also one that evokes the energy you want to give off.

Longevity

When picking a cologne to invest in, it’s crucial to consider how long-lasting it is. Longevity refers to how long the aroma remains on our bodies before it eventually fades from our skin.

When purchasing a cologne, especially an expensive one, you want to ensure it won’t fade an hour after use. There is no point in wearing a cologne that fades easily, especially when they are designed to leave us smelling amazing for the duration of a work day or a night out.

Checking reviews is the best way to determine the longevity of a product. Jean Paul Gaultier isn’t the most expensive name brand, but most colognes produce high-quality, long-lasting scents.

Sillage

Longevity and sillage go hand-in-hand, but they aren’t the same thing. Longevity refers to how long an aroma sticks; sillage refers to how far a cologne’s aroma reaches. How important it is for a cologne to be strong enough to smell it from a foot or two away is up to you.

If you’re wearing cologne to impress those around you, you’ll want to ensure it has high sillage. Wearing a strong-scented cologne with high sillage is ideal, but if the person standing beside you can’t smell it, the purpose is defeated.

However, if you’re wearing a cologne for your nose only, sillage may not be high on your priority list. Especially if you’re comfortable with just you or your significant other smelling the cologne, longevity and scent may be your biggest concerns.

Seasonal

Like food, clothes, and other luxuries in life, aromas can be seasonal. Certain scents can register with a particular time of the year, especially for those living in areas where the weather shifts every couple of months.

For example, cinnamon and apple remind us of the fall or holiday seasons. Similarly, warm and woody colognes tend to be perfect for the winter months, reminding us of campfires and comfort foods.

If you’re looking to purchase a cologne in the summer, you might want to consider finding energetic and refreshing colognes with fruity, aquatic, green, or energetic notes. These scents match the need for something refreshing when the sun is at its hottest.

This matters only if you think it matters.

The beauty of colognes and perfumes is our taste and what scents speak to us. You could find a cologne that you love and want to wear year-round. Certain colognes fit every month whether that’s your intention or not.
